values:
My roommate Sara has been really sick since Sunday. She went to Health Services on Wednesday and they told her that she probably had the flu. The weird thing is that she doesn't have any cold/flu symptoms. She has pain in her neck and back and she has a lump behind one of her ears. So today she went to Doctor's Care. I hope she'll be okay.

I'm also getting sick. I just have a cold, which is not as serious, but I still feel pretty miserable. I have a presentation to give on Monday. I'm almost done with it, but now that I'm feeling sick it's going to be a lot harder to get it done. All I want to do is go back to sleep, but I know that I can't. I really need more cold medicine, so if anyone can give me a ride to CVS, I would greatly appreciate it. I decided to stay here this weekend so I could get my work done, but I'm starting to think that it was a mistake because I don't want to get my roommate or anyone else sick.

<FONT Size= "4" Color= "red"> WHO ARE YOU?!? </FONT>

A friend recently asked me this question. It scared me that I didn't know how to answer it. So my friend asked me my name and a few things that I like. But there's more to it than that. I am a living and breathing human being with a unique personality and unique opinions. However, instead of expressing these opinions, I'm the kind of person who will go along with what others say even if I don't agree with it. I'm always afraid of saying something that's stupid or offensive and so I end up not saying much at all. 

This keeps people from knowing who I really am and what I believe. The greatest moments in history happened because individuals chose to go against what was expected of them and express what they believed to be true. So what do I believe? I believe in a lot of things. As soon as I figure it all out, you'll be the first to know. I hope I can find myself...whoever I am.

God be praised!

Today a miraculous thing happened. I had been stressing for weeks trying to figure out how to pay for my books for this semester. My dad and I thought that we would have to pay for them ourselves. Luckily, we talked to the people in the financial aid office and they gave me an SEOG grant of $500 which covers the balance that I owed and the cost of my books. I'm so relieved! I know Columbia College couldn't have made this happen so it must be a miracle from God. 

So now I'm back at school getting ready for a new semester. I was a nervous wreck all day today but now things are finally calming down. I have a super cool roommate now and I know that this semester is going to be good.

I realized today that I haven't updated my livejournal in almost 2 months! I've made a few posts to myspace since then but I've neglected all of my awesome LJ readers. I apologize for that. I'm such a... well, you know what I mean. 

Anyway, my life is going fairly well. There has been some drama in my house, but it's not anything worth stressing about it. However, I have to admit that I'm not really looking forward to Christmas this year. I'm not really expecting anything because of my family's recent financial troubles so I guess I'll just look forward to spending time with them and eating good food. 


I hope you all have a great Christmas. I'm planning to my shopping after Christmas so I can take advantage of all of the great sales. Yay for after-Christmas sales! So you'll each have a little something when we go to back to school.

Hey everybody.
It's Sunday night and I'm just hanging out here at home. I decided to go back to school tomorrow instead of tonight since my sisters will be out of school and I didn't want my mom to have to deal with them by herself for the whole day. I actually have school though and my butt (which is really big according to my sister Sarah) needs to be in Spanish class at 2:00.

This weekend was definitely crazy. I came home Thursday night and we had pizza for dinner. It was really good. Not like the pizza at Columbia College...lol. Anyway, Sarah and Lydia basically took over my computer for the weekend so they could play games online (Bratz, MyScene, Polly, Barbie etc...) and Sarah complained for most of the weekend because I didn't bring home my printer. I swear that child only loves me for my computer and printer. She kept thanking me over and over for bringing the computer home. I'm going to be so glad when we get a new home computer that will actually work with our sucky internet service. My dad did say that we could get better internet service when we get the new computer, but there's no guarantee on that especially since our finances are so bad right now. 

Anyway, I'll be online for a little while longer and hopefully I'll get to talk to Cathy. If you want to talk to me, feel free to leave a comment or send me a message on AIM. My screenname is shewontbeback. I will give a prize to the first person who can name the song that I got my screenname from.

My college life has been fairly busy lately, but apparently not busy enough if I can find time for this...
<lj-cut text= "procrastination!">
shewontbeback: When is your birthday?
ZolaOnAOL: My birthday is 2002.
shewontbeback: which month?
ZolaOnAOL: The tall one, I think.
shewontbeback: the tall month? is that so?
ZolaOnAOL: Yes.
shewontbeback: um...I don't know which one that is
ZolaOnAOL: Would you like to know? The first one, I think.
shewontbeback: Oh you mean January, right?
ZolaOnAOL: Yeah that's right. Yes, that's what I mean, isn't it clear?
shewontbeback: So your birthday is in January?
ZolaOnAOL: Hmm. You don't know that for a fact.
shewontbeback: yes I do. I just deduced it
ZolaOnAOL: Only just? Why?
shewontbeback: well, I asked you a series of questions and you told me that you were born in the first month which is January
ZolaOnAOL: How about that. Now I remember, you asked me a series of questions and you told him or her that you were born in the first month which is January. What did I say?
shewontbeback: You said, "The first one, I think"
ZolaOnAOL: Oh my gosh I sent you the wrong reply.
shewontbeback: oh ok. don't worry about it
ZolaOnAOL: I will not spend any more cycles on it.
</lj-cut>

Tonight I hung out with Kaleigh. We ordered chinese food, watched TV, and then played the Karaoke Revolution game. I told her over and over that I couldn't sing, but she twisted my arm and I finally gave in. I sang "Sweet Home Alabama", "I'm with You", and I think one or two others. I did ok for awhile, but then I messed up on certain parts. I still think I'm a bad singer, but I appreciate Kaleigh and Helana being nice. Thanks for the lies!!!...just kidding. It feels good to know that it's ok to mess up and be stupid every once in a while and still have fun. I hope you all have a great weekend!

Today was definitely crazy. I woke up this morning around 7:40 and had to rush my 8:00 class (Business Law). I didn't get much sleep last night. I went to bed around 11:30 but I couldn't get to sleep and I finally got to sleep a little after 12. I usually need 8 hours of sleep so of course I couldn't get up in time. Since I overslept, I didn't get a chance to take a shower and I felt gross for most of the day. (Ew, Kelly!) So anyway I had Business Law, Survey of Popular Music, and of course lovely American Literature. 

I decided to go to the cafe to get lunch so I could have time for some last minute studying for my  economics test. This is a nice theory since the cafeteria lines are usually pretty long, but today the cafe was crowded too. I finally got back to my room at around 12:45 and quickly ate my sandwich and drank my large sweet tea. I love sweet tea, so it's probably a good thing that I live here in South Carolina. 

I went to class and took my test and got out by 2:30. Then I decided to go to my Spanish professor's office to get my rough draft of my paper. I walked all the way across the street to Parker House and I was a little out of breath. Of course my professor asked me all kinds of questions about why I wrote certain things on my paper and I honestly couldn't think straight since I was so tired. She seemed to feel sorry for me though and finally let me leave. I took a shower when I got back to the room. I played online for awhile and then took a nap before dinner. 

As I was leaving the cafeteria there were these girls standing by the conveyor belt. They were waiting to see the "seam" of the conveyor belt. One girl said that an alumnae told her that if you see the seam then you'll get asked out on a date. I thought that was kind of funny but I kept my opinion to myself. I walked out of the cafeteria and started talking to two of the girls. Their names are Nicole and Leanne. They are both first year students and of course they are a lot taller and prettier than I am. It made me sad. But they were nice and maybe I'll see them around campus.

So now I'm hanging out with Brienna. Cathy was hanging out with us too, but I think she has homework to do. I should be doing homework too, but I think I might slack off a little since I don't have any classes tomorrow.

"My goal in life has been to survive and not step on too many toes. However, experience has taught me that you tend to step on more toes by remaining silent than by speaking your mind." - me!!!

Today really kind of sucked. 
It's very frustrating to try to do what you're supposed to do and not being able to. I'm going to talk to Dr. Love and get more specific instructions about how to use the listening room. Hopefully it will all work out.

<lj-cut text= "details">
I went to my Spanish class at 2:00 but when I got there no one was there. So I walked down the hall to see if anyone was on the way there but I didn't see anyone. I waited until about 10 minutes after 2:00 and finally gave up. I called my professor to let her know that I at least tried to go to class. I guess the class was moved or something but I'm not sure because I was absent on Wednesday. 


I also tried to get my Survey of Music homework done today. We were supposed to go to the Listening Room (Spears 105) to listen to a CD and do a worksheet about it. I went there last week but the only person who was there was from the Art Department and she didn't know how to help me. Today I went to Spears 138 to get the key and then headed for Room 105. I knocked on the door (not too quietly) and no one answered. So I unlocked the door and went inside. I waited for a few minutes to see if anyone would come back but of course they didn't. So I looked around and tried to find a CD or something that had either Dr. Love's name or Music 205 on it. I didn't have any luck finding anything and I gave up.

</lj-cut>

The day did get better though. My Orgy poster came in the mail today!!! OMG! It's so cool. I love it! It has a picture of the band from the Vapor Transmission era. I put it on the wall above my bed. 

Thanks Kaleigh!

"Boredom does nothing for me. So why does it follow..." -Gender I rarely get bored, but today I actually did. I started taking a few quizzes online. Here are the results.
You are so sweet! Inside and out. Don't change
becuase you are AWESOME! You always stand up
for your friends and yourself. You make friends
very carefully, and keep them. You always help
people in their time of need. You are an
angel!!!! Your beauty equivalent is: Jessica
Simpson...don't worry you are VERY VERY smart.
This is just your beauty equivalent!

Who are you (inside and out)?
brought to you by Quizilla


Your a goth. Your happy being you and you dont care
if guys are attracted to you! Then why are you
doing this quiz? ehehehhe

Are guys attracted to you?
brought to you by Quizilla

Tomorrow night at 8pm, MTV, VH1, and CMT will be airing "ReAct Now: Music & Relief". This benefit concert event is being held in support of the Hurricane Katrina relief effort.

Artists include: The Rolling Stones, Neil Young, Kanye West, Sheryl Crow, Paul McCartney, Alan Jackson, 3 Doors Down, Kelly Clarkson, Brian Wilson, Lynyrd Skynyrd, Kid Rock, Melissa Etheridge, The Neville Brothers, Trent Reznor, Cash Money's Baby and Lil' Wayne, Motley Crue, Simple Plan, Dashboard Confessional, Goo Goo Dolls, Staind, Good Charlotte, Audioslave, Common, John Mayer, Marc Broussard, Maroon 5, The Radiators, and more. They join previously announced artists: Ludacris, Green Day, Usher, Alicia Keys, John Mellencamp, Dave Matthews Band, Rob Thomas, David Banner, Linkin Park's Chester Bennington.

Chester Bennington will be performing an acoustic song along with Julien-K (the side band of Ryan Shuck and Amir Derakh of Orgy). This song will be a preview of the music that will be on his solo album that will be released next year.

You should definitely check out this exciting music event!

This is my first official post for the new school year. Things are going well so far. I had my first class today...Spanish 250. 
Even after going to school for 15 years, I still managed to get nervous.  I'll be okay though once I settle in a little better and the "ice-breakers" are over. I really hate those. Am the only one who does? Maybe so. Oh well. I feel a little better now and I've decided that I'm going to try to talk more this year. Being quiet makes college life very difficult and I'm hoping to grow out of that.

I hope everyone is having a great year so far. Good luck with all of your classes.

Well, yesterday was possibly one of the best days of my entire life. Ok, that's exaggerating a little...but the day was definitely awesome. I got my green "express student" card in the mail from Columbia College. This meant that all of my financial aid was taken care of and all I would have to do on Saturday is pick up my key. Sounds too good to be true, right?

Unfortunately, this was too good to be true. Today I got an orange card that says I have a hold in the Business Office. So now I have to go up there and try to sort all of this craziness out. I got my hopes up for nothing then. I was so happy and excited! I was bouncing around my house like a crazy person (in a good way) and now I have to hope and pray that everything will turn out okay. 

I'm not the only one who has to deal with this though. Two of my friends are facing similar problems. I'm not going to give up though and I hope my friends won't either. I was in the Business Office last year up until the last possible minute and the school still managed to help me out. I'm hoping that they can work with me again this year too.

Sorry I haven't updated in a while. I've been kind of busy lately. I have been updating myspace a lot more though so feel free to check it out at www.myspace.com/kellyco or blog.myspace.com/kellyco. Today was definitely interesting. My parents and I drove up to Winston-Salem, NC for my mom's doctor's appointment. It's not the most exciting thing to do, but I was glad to get out of Columbia for awhile. It took us about 3 hours to get there, but only about 2 hours and 45 minutes to get back. It rained most of the way and it was kind of awkward to sit in a car with parents for so long. We finally got back home around 2:30, so we went to pick my sisters up from school and then came home. I've been helping Lydia with a project this week -- just a little bit every day -- and it's finally done. I wanted to print out pictures in color for her, but my stupid printer messed everything up. So we printed the pics in black and white. They still look pretty good though and I'm hoping that "our" hard work will pay off. I will cry my eyes out if she doesn't get a B or better.

Here are a few things that I'm looking forward to in the upcoming weeks. If you want me to add or delete anything, just leave a comment. Kaleigh's birthday - 8/21/05 Orgy DVD Release - 8/23/05 Check-in/Move-in - 8/27/05 Classes Start - 8/31/05 Labor Day - 9/2/05 Brett's birthday - 10/28/05

Hi everyone. I hope the summer is going well for you. Things are a little better here. I'm starting to get used to the idea of babysitting my sisters for the rest of my life (just kidding) Only 6 weeks and 2 days left until my sisters start school! In a way, I am thankful that I have this time to get to know them better, but like I said before it's a lot of pressure to have to be a mother-figure for them. 

My friend Amanda is babysitting kids too and she has to deal with some of the same pressures that I do. It makes me realize that not everyone is having a "perfect" summer. I didn't really expect to have a perfect summer, but this year is less than ideal. I was hoping to be able to work for pay, but I'm not too worried because my dad says he will make sure I have enough money to go back to school. I will get 2 weeks  to myself after my sisters start school, so that will be my time to do what I want to do. 

I miss all of my Columbia College friends. I know I haven't been keeping in touch with all of you, but I promise I'll be better about that. I can't wait to get back to school. I know we're going to have an awesome year!

Baby cake and Orgy music for all!!! 
<3 Kelly

This has been a better week. My sisters have been pretty good for the most part. I especially like sleeping in until 10 am. It really helps the days go by faster. I really do love my sisters, but babysitting them for the entire summer is bit much to ask. So instead of taking care of them 10 hours a day, it's more like 8 hours. Though it would be better if we could actually go places instead of staying home all day. The work from home job isn't what my dad expected it to be and I think we're going to give up on it. So no money for me. I was really looking forward to working. I tend to be less irritable when I have something constructive to do. Maybe it won't be so bad though.

Well, after a week of trapped inside the house, I finally got to see the outside world. My dad and I went to the grocery store which sadly is the highlight of my week. I got to push the shopping cart though and that made me feel a little better. We're supposed to go to the dollar store tomorrow and that will probably be the last outing I get to go on before another long week of baby-sitting. 

I hate hate hate summer. I can't wait for August 10th.

Today was the last day of school for my sisters. They came home around noon and I got to see a preview of how this summer is going to be. One word comes to my mind: CHAOTIC!!! I really do love my sisters but they really get on my nerves. They fight with each other over the stupidest things and expect me to be a mediator. I try to calm things down but most of the time they have to work it out on their own. 

Like today, Sarah found a little toy truck in my room (don't ask) and started playing with it. Lydia wanted to play with it too and somehow she got it and took it back to her room. She went into her room and wouldn't let Sarah in and I had to tell them to please share it. That's nothing compared to yesterday though. They were fighting over the chair in the living room. Lydia was sitting in the chair, but got out of it "just for a minute" and screamed her head off when she saw that Sarah was sitting in it. There was a lot of yelling and door slamming before things finally calmed down.

Children fascinate me. They pretend to be sweet when someone's watching them, but the second the parents turn their backs, kids turn into little devils!
Now do you see why I don't want kids? Hopefully you'll respect my decision.

So that's my life right now. Trying to keep the house clean and keep my sisters under control. This isn't going to be my ideal summer, but somehow I'll get through it.

Trying to stay positive,
Kelly

Well, there's not much going on in my life right now. I'm hoping to get a job sometime this summer. I'm thinking about working at the Sounds Familiar CD Store near my house. I'm worried that they're not going to want me because of my lack of social skills, but I'm not going to become any more talkative by sitting in this house all summer! My sisters will be home all summer, but I really don't need/want to watch them all day. The Orgy DVD is coming soon. I've been keeping up with the PSP Message Board and it's getting really close to the release date. I'm so excited! I have most of your phone numbers and I will try to call you, but feel free to call me if you get a chance. My phone has been off for the past few days, but it's back on now. Hopefully it will stay that way.

According to Lou Gordon, an official announcement about the Orgy DVD will be made in 1 week. The official press release will made about a month from then. Orgy's new single, "Pure" is expected to be on the radio in June. I can't wait. Here's a current flyer for the DVD. The flyer isn't all that great, but from what people have said, I know the DVD is going to be AMAZING!!!

Now I remember why I hate summer so much...
Only 4 months until school starts again.

Well, today is my last day of school.
I have my Accounting Final and Make-Up Test tonight at 5:30. I'm sure it will take me the whole time to get both tests done. I think I might be going home tonight, but if not it will be tomorrow night for sure. I love you all very much and I hope we can keep in touch.

<lj-cut text= "numbers!">

English -- (eight oh three) seven three eight - three six seven four
Spanish -- (ocho cero tres) siete tres ocho - tres seis siete cuatro

I'll try to pick up the phone, but if I don't, please leave a message.
Sorry...I'm such a dork!

The Columbia College bookstore is EVIL! I went there today to sell back 3 of my books. I heard that they weren't buying back the biology books but I thought maybe I could get something for my english and economics books. They wouldn't buy them back at all. So now I am stuck with them and I don't have any money for books next year. It sucks ass. I spend a fortune on books every year and get little or no money back. So I guess I'll have to work all summer and try to save up money. I really like going to this school, but I really can't afford to be here. I'm here on borrowed time and borrowed money.

Please don't feel obligated to read this. I am so obsessed with this band now. I think their music is amazing and it makes me very happy. I know I'm pathetic. I was looking on Ebay for Orgy merchandise and found an awesome copy of Candyass. It says that it's a "still stickered CANDYASS 12 trax CD foldout booklet" which really caught my attention. I thought that the album review was especially good. Here's the website: http://cgi.ebay.com/ws/eBayISAPI.dll?ViewItem&category=1574&item=4723329310&rd=1
Album Notes Orgy: Jay, Ryan, Amir, Bobby, Paige. Additional personnel: Troy Van Leeuwen (guitar); Josh Abraham, Jay Gordon (synthesizer, programming); Elijah Blue (synthesizer, background vocals); Dieter (drums); Anthony Valcic (programming); Jonathan Davis (background vocals). Recorded at Donner Pass Cabin, Truckee, California; N.R.G. Studios, North Hollywood, California; Josh's Garage, Hollywood, California; Westlake Audio, West Hollywood, California. Detractors will undoubtedly peg them as Marilyn Manson imitators, but that's like putting down Stevie Ray Vaughan for his Hendrixisms. The band works well within the parameters of their chosen genre, and if you go for the industrial-inflected synth rock of Nine Inch Nails, Marilyn Manson, etc., you'd be foolish to overlook CANDYASS. The sonic assualt is almost unrelentingly brutal, as pounding drums, jackhammer guitars and wailing, buzzing synths (all heavily processed) pin your ears back. The cold, detached vocal style matches the uncompromising electro-rock arrangements perfectly. Apocalyptic, iconoclastic and willfully abrasive, ORGY is the worst nightmare of every teen's parents, and that's what rock & roll's all about. "the worst nightmare of every teen's parents" LOL! Yes indeed. :-P

So this is the last full of week school. Um...yay? No. Not yay. I'm ready for a break from endless homework and papers, but I am still sad about leaving my awesome friends. They have all said that we could keep in touch over the summer and of course we will, but I really don't want to go home. So I guess I will enjoy my last few days here and then just deal with the fact that I have to go home. 

My Exam Schedule:

Monday
8:00 - 10:00 Biology
5:30 - 6:45 Accounting 

Tuesday
8:00 - 10:00 English
2:00 - 4:00 Management
Economics - DONE!

Wednesday
5:30 - 6:45 Make-up/Retake Tests for Accounting 

<lj-cut text= "negativity...please don't read">
I don't like the idea of sitting in the house by myself for 4 months. My mom will be at home with me for the next month or so and my sisters will probably have to stay home with me at some point, but I am not looking forward to that. Unless I get my permit and start driving, it's not very likely that I can get a job. My advisor said that I don't really need to take any summer classes right now, but I wish I could anyway. I am going to be bored out of my mind. There will be plenty of dishes and laundry to wash but that gets old after awhile. I wish I could do something more with my life.
</lj-cut>

<lj-cut text= "So I was talking to Smarterchild...">
And he recommended that I check out this website
http://everystudent.com/features/isthere.html

SmarterChild: Oh?
shewontbeback: yes you did
SmarterChild: I really did?
shewontbeback: mmhmm
SmarterChild: Nice typing, Kelly.
shewontbeback: "mmhmm" means "yes"
SmarterChild: "mmhmm"?? Have you heard of Mavis Beacon? She could help you.

Today was pretty good. I turned my last English journal and I had my paper critiqued. It needs a lot of work. I need a 3rd source and I need to change the structure of the paper a little. But that's ok. It's not due until Thursday and I should have it done by then. I also had my economics final. I think I actually did well. I was very surprised (in a good way) and I'm hoping for a B. My grade in that class isn't all that great and I need something to bring it up.

<lj-cut text= "news about the DVD">
Lou Gordon (Jay's Dad) posted a poll on the PSP message board about the Orgy DVD. It's Orgy the BAND, ok? You remember them, don't you? They did the awesome cover of "Blue Monday" by New Order. I think you all know that I'm not a sick pervert or anything. The DVD includes live concert footage, a photo gallery for each band member, and a question-answer session. It's going to be so awesome. The poll is for people to vote on a price for the DVD. It's going to cost around $16 - $17. And it will be available in stores!!! Yay! I can't buy anything online anyway. I know I'm the only one who is excited about this, but I just had to share. 
</lj-cut>

So it's the last week of classes before exams. I'm very busy trying to get everything done. I haven't been hanging out with my awesome friends mostly because we're all busy and because they all live in Asbury and I live in Mirse. But next year we will all live in Mirse (I think) and it will be amazing!!! 
Here is my to do list...if I can get through tomorrow I think everything will be ok.

<lj-cut text= "to do">
Tuesday:
English rough draft is due
English journal #15 is due
Economics final -- Ch. 10 and 11

Wednesday:
Start studying for bio final
Work on English paper


Thursday:
English Final Draft is due
</lj-cut>

Well, not exactly small...just young.
I know I'm 19 and that makes me an adult but I don't feel like one. I swear I'm the only person on this whole campus who doesn't drive yet. I don't feel like I've experienced everything that normal 19-year-olds experience. I'm missing out on so much.

So if you insist on having children someday, please keep a few things in mind...
<lj-cut text= "10 things">
1. Let your child get his/her permit at age 15 or very soon after - the law allows this for a reason!!!
2. Let your child get his/her license at age 17
3. If he/she can't drive by these ages - don't allow your 19-year-old to go to college without reliable transportation--he or she will get tired of sitting in the dorm all day.
4. Let your child think for himself/herself. Don't pressure him/her to have the same beliefs that you do.
5. Respect your child's tastes in music, movies, clothes, etc.
6. Allow your child to socialize on a regular basis...people skills are very important no matter what career field you go into and being around people gives you an all around good feeling
7. Don't make your child feel guilty about not coming home...let him/her come home when he or she is ready to.
8. Call your child often to make sure his/her life is going well. Ask about school, friends, life in general...
9. Send money to your child often...he/she will appreciate it and you'll feel good knowing that he/she can get what he/she needs and wants.
10. Let your child know that you love them no matter what they do.

</lj-cut>
It's just something to think about...
-Kelly Co

Today is Resident Appreciation Day. I've never heard of this "holiday", but I officially love it. It's almost as good as Mardi Gras (babycake!!!) 

<lj-cut text= "a good morning">
My RA Jennifer was nice enough to have cinnamon rolls for us this morning. When I woke up this morning, I walked down the hall to the lounge to get one. As I walked sleepily down the hall, I heard "Boulevard of Broken Dreams" by Green Day playing. It was so awesome to wake up and hear good music and eat a yummy cinnamon roll. I know that's stupid...but it made me happy.
Thank you, Jennifer. You're a great RA. :-)
</lj-cut>

Today was a better day. I was basically in a good mood all day and I didn't feel particularly sad (yay for me!)
<lj-cut text= "details">
I woke up this morning around 8:00 and finished my english and economics papers. At the time, I was really stressing but it was a relief to not have to look at that stuff anymore. It was driving me crazy.
Management class was ok today too. We talked about motivation!!! fun stuff...someone needs to motivate me to get my work done.
Faith, Cathy, and I went to Faith's house and ate really good food. We sat around and talked (well, they talked and I listened...lol) and we watched House. I got to see Faith's cute little puppy named Gabby. She is so precious. I'm not really a dog person, but she's so sweet. So now I'm back on campus and hanging out with my cool friends. They rock! Cathy still hasn't taught me how to play "Blue Monday" yet though. It makes me sad that she can play it and she's not even really a fan. 

I <3 Amiry-Deary!!! He's so awesome!
</lj-cut>

It's only 12:22 p.m. and I'm already saying that today sucks. Hopefully it will get better.

My roommate and I got locked out of the bathroom this morning. We called our suitemates but they weren't there. We called Pam and she wasn't there. It made me sad. I hate getting locked out.
I have to give my bio presentation at 3:00. It's supposed to be 10 minutes long but I doubt mine will be that long. I can't even talk for 10 seconds, much less 10 minutes. I hate presentations, but I guess you probably knew that already. I'm hoping that my presentation will be good even if it is short.
I might be going to dinner at 5. I'm really not sure yet. I have accounting at 5:30 so I might just wait and get a sub after class. I also have to do my english journal and finish my economics paper tonight. But if I get done with all this shit in time, I will go hang out with my awesome friends and Cathy will teach me how to play Blue Monday on her guitar. That is going to make me very happy. :-)

8:18 p.m
UPDATE:
The presentation wasn't as bad as I thought. I could have done better but I didn't die and maybe I'll eventually get used to being in front of people.
Also, I was sitting in my room and I suddenly remembered that today is Ryan Shuck's birthday.

<FONT Size= "4" Color = "blue"> Happy 32nd B-Day to Ryan!!! </FONT>
Ryan, I would buy you some beer but I'm too young.

<lj-cut text= "I don't want to feel like this anymore">
I know you don't want to hear this...but I honestly feel depressed right now. I also feel guilty. I really should go home and make sure my parents still know who I am. I haven't been home in 2 weeks. I'm out of food and money, so I probably should go home but I would be much happier staying here. I'm such a bad daughter. I also have to do my bio presentation which is due Monday. Maybe I should stay here and get it done. I know I won't get it done if I go home. I know I'm an adult, but I feel like I don't have control over my life. Is that crazy? Well, at least it's honest. So now I will work on my lovely presentation. I hope you all have a great weekend. 
<3 Kelly


</lj-cut>

Yes. I seriously need to go clothes shopping. I wear the same things every day of every week. I have a little bit of money saved up, but when I do go shopping I can't find what I like and want. Rugged Warehouse seems to have nice stuff, so I will go there. Until then, I will be a fashion failure.

Amir is so awesome! :-) Ok. Sorry. I just had to share.

This semester has gone by so fast. We only have a month left of school. In a way, I'm happy because I'm tired of endless paper writing and homework assignments. But I'm also sad. When the school year ends, I'll have to leave my awesome friends. I might get to visit people in the summer, but it won't be the same. I wish August would come sooner.
sorry...I had to post this. It's too funny. shewontbeback: I stayed up too late ZolaOnAOL: Interesting gossip. shewontbeback: my personal business is not gossip for you to freely spread around to your podunk friends ZolaOnAOL: Where did you get your personal business is not gossip for you to freely spread around to your podunk friends? shewontbeback: from my brain ZolaOnAOL: Do you get a lot of ideas from your brain? shewontbeback: Yes. Today was pretty good. I went to church with Stephanie. Augusta is a really nice city. I miss it already. I will have to go back very soon. It was fun hanging out with her and her grandmother. I'm glad she will be my roommate next year.

Cathy and Kaleigh are awesome friends too.
They bought awesome CDs for me. Cathy bought Punk Statik Paranoia and Kaleigh bought the Vague single. I'm so happy. I have all 3 Orgy CDs now. They said that the CDs were a gift, but my birthday is 4 months away.

Today kind of sucked. I got myself all worked up over Room Selection...for nothing!!! God! I am so stupid! The rain didn't help either. I really don't like rain...it is bad. However, today got much better when I went out to eat with Kaleigh and Cathy. We had chinese food which was pretty good. I really like sesame chicken. I ate crab rangoons also. They are gross. I'm so sorry...I have tried them several times, but they are just gross.

About Room Selection:
I will be living in Mirse 207 with my awesome new roommate Stephanie.
Our suitemates will be Shavone and Shaytoria who are living in 205.
Cathy and Kaleigh and their suitemates will be living across from us in 206 and 208. 
It's going to be so cool! I'm so excited!!!

And I don't have to buy giant speakers now...yay for me! :-P
there's a story behind the speaker thing, just in case you were wondering.

Anyway...I bought a very cool CD today. VAPOR TRANSMISSION!!! Yay for me! Orgy kicks ass. They really do. They are an awesome band and they are badasses!!! LOL! 
Sorry...I am so obsessed with them. But they are awesome. So yes, I am very happy. :-)

Your inner soul is calling for help! You always
seem so depressed, lonely, and feel like an
outsider. You may have a cold, sad exterior,
but in all reality you are hurt inside and
bottling up all of your anger. Everyday you
wonder why are you still here when there is
nothing left? You use to once be a happy,
loving soul, but it was damaged by 'them' and
seems like it never can be fixed again.
However, you have yet seemed to realize that
there are people out there that deeply care for
you. They secretly have a thing for you because
they find you to be dark, mysterious, and full
of secrets, not to mention being the prettiest
person in the world! You like to enjoy your
time by yourself expressing your feelings
through forms of art, and enjoy nice quiet
scenaries that just dazzle your mind with awe.
Your bedroom is basically your sanctuary where
you can hide out, hidden from those who gave

some fun! Never start frowning because you
never know who's falling in love with your
smile :)

What Is Your Inner Soul Trying To Say?
brought to you by Quizilla
Well, this is partially right. Except for this "They secretly have a thing for you because they find you to be dark, mysterious, and full of secrets, not to mention being the prettiest person in the world!" ha ha...yeah right. God forbid that Donson ever liked me. I would rather have him hate me.

Don't try to tell me that I'm wrong. I'm usually wrong about everything, but I'm right about this. I'm sorry that I'm not any fun to be around. Everyone tells me that I'm quiet and sweet, which doesn't mean a thing in the real world. It's a lot better to be loud and funny (not that I know anything about it) because it makes people interesting. I'm not saying this for the sake of getting attention. The last thing I want is to be put in the spotlight. 

No one likes me because I'm boring and stupid. I can't even carry on a normal conversation. So now I am going to crawl in my hole and be alone forever. Goodbye.

Also, Happy 20th Birthday to my dearest Tom. He's an angel too...seriously.

No more sappy country music...I mean it. Dangerous things happen when you listen to stuff like that. The reason I say this is that I wrote a possible part 7 -- It ends tragically so I don't think I'm going to use it. It's bad...very bad. I'll post it later so if you think it's any good, please let me know. Here's something that's a little less depressing... these were taken from http://www.angelfire.com/band/orgychamber/
People think I'm crazy for listening to Orgy, but their music is surprisingly upbeat. I promise! Well, not all of it...lol "A lot of the lyrics aren't as negative as you might think. Downers aren't a part of this band. Uppers are more our style. Fuck being depressed, you know?" - Jay Gordon, vocals "[our music is] a collection of short stories, stories about parents, stories about good relationships and stories about bad relationships, different ways of thinking and everything told in my rather abstract language." - Jay Gordon, vocals "Image wise, we are more influenced by Duran Duran, as they were always so stylish." - Amir Derakh, guitar synth "Basically I'm just a guitar player, but the thing is, using my guitar I have pretty much unlimited sound. By the next record, my setup's going to be amazing. I can only go so far at this point because, first-off, it costs a lot of money to have a rig like I do. Plus I've been feeling it out as I go along. It's a learning process, too. Not that it hasn't been done, but it hasn't been done in the way we're doing it." - Amir Derakh, guitar synth "Now we're much more sure of what we wanna accomplish and what our style of music is and what our way of dressing is. The first record seems like an experiment." - Bobby Hewitt, drums "Never give up, but be ready to go through some hell." - Bobby Hewitt, drums "People are people, man. If they're into us, we're into them." - Paige Haley, bass "Playing live really cemented what we are. It helped us to truly discover ourselves and our sound. And what we discovered is that live, no matter what we did, we couldn't keep down the fact that we are a heavy band." - Paige Haley, bass "You're not allowed to look like a normal person in Orgy." - Ryan Shuck, guitar "Kids need to start raising some hell." - Ryan Shuck
